result: Queestión 75) ¿Did a mirage help sink Titani? The optical phenomenon known as FATA Morgan can cause a false wall of water to appear on the wet horizon. When conditions are favorable, light reflected by cold water can be diverted by an unusual layer of hot air above, coming to the observer from many different angles. According to studies by researchers at the University of San Diego, a FATA Morgan may have obscured the icebergs of the view of the crew that was aboaard the Titani. Thus, at a certain distance, the true horizon is covered by a darkened mist, which looks a lot of calm waters in the dark.
